title: The public have a right to know how their money is spent
text:
The Metropolitan Police has paid compensation to the family of Mark Duggan

Mark Duggan was a well-known local gangster and drug dealer in north London who was shot dead by the police in August 2011 during an operation in which armed officers thought he was carrying a gun. An inquest into his death concluded that he was lawfully killed. The courts refused a request from Duggan’s family to challenge this verdict.

To all intents and purposes, therefore, a violent criminal had suffered the fatal consequences of his chosen way of life. While anyone’s death is a bereavement for parents and siblings, the responsibility for what happened rests with the dead man. So why has the Metropolitan Police paid...
